title: Pumpkin Spice Oreo Cookie Review - Oreo Oration
description:
Can there ever be enough pumpkin? 

Support us on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/kindafunny

SUBSCRIBE / LIKE / SHARE / BUY A SHIRT: http://www.districtlines.com/kindafunny

While you were living your life, Nabisco went crazy and made an army of Oreo cookies. Whenever a noteworthy cookie comes, Greg Miller tears open a new package and reviews a new version of Milk's Favorite Cookie. 

Subscribe so you don't miss a review: http://www.youtube.com/user/gameovergreggy?sub_confirmation=1

Let us know what Oreo we should review next in the comments.

Follow Greg on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gameovergreggy

Like Greg on Facebook: http://facebook.com/gameovergreggy

Check out the Oreo Oration FAQ: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aO6zw2LeJ3c&list=PLOlEpGVXWUVseSo6bQHB1ad2cN_qV3aXs&index=1

Our theme is "Game-A-Tron" off of Daemon Hatfield's album Colorbeam. Buy it on iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/colorbeam/id426986325

Thanks to Nick and Tim for filming.

Mega-Thanks to Matt Gravish for making the Oreo Oration logo and intro.

transcript_chunks.text: what's up everybody Welcome to Oreo Oration I'm Greg Miller and while you were out living your life the folks at Oreo are making endless variations to Milk's Favorite Cookie, so every well whenever I feel like it really or there's a big Oreo in the news I get together and I give you a tasty review without any calories but if you want to see Oration come back all the time as a monthly show maybe even weekly you got to go over to Kinda Funny.com and back our Patreon where one of the perks is indeed the return of Oration today we're reviewing Pumpkin Spice Oreos so let's not beat around the bush here ladies and gentlemen I love pumpkin spice stuff, love it to death, Pumpkin Spice Latte yeah here's how obsessive I was when I didn't have much money I went out to the mall and they had the the pumpkin breads there right and I was like I love pumpkin bread so I went I bought some I I couldn't afford it I brought home made it I loved it so much I went back to that store and bought enough

the pumpkin breads there right and I was like I love pumpkin bread so I went I bought some I I couldn't afford it I brought home made it I loved it so much I went back to that store and bought enough pumpkin bread in pumpkin in cans to make pumpkin bread throughout the year now did I do it no forgot about it all went bad wasted a lot of money I don't suggest doing that but now Oreo's gone the extra step of putting pumpkin spice into Oreos so hopefully now you see you got the golden cookie of course and then you got the pumpkin in there a little bit of cinnamon sticks they're trying to make it sound like it's going to taste like pumpkin pie we'll be the judge of that of course every Oreo Oration begins with the patented First Look it's a little tough bugger here we go okay the first look is pretty godamn promising you know I'm a big pumpkins fan and these definitely smell like pumpkin now that's the smell test of the first look if we want to look at them themselves we'll see they

like they they they're not melty but they definitely don't seem the cream doesn't seem to be fighting back against the cookie like our normal flavored Oreos here in the Oreo Oration first looks pretty good though they're together cocka made me it looks like I got screwed out of a few ones there no big deal now it's time to move on to what always matters of course the taste I like where we're headed oh yeah we're in a good place I'm pretty goddamn happy ladies and gentlemen cuz again I was afraid that you're going to screw this up I love pumpkin literally if you're like Greg Miller they what's the perfect Oreo they can make for you I'd first say chicken wings but then I'd pull back cuz that's disgusting and then I'd think about it and I would say pumpkin and so far so good and I guess there's not much more further to go since they taste really good well it's a mini pumpkin pie you've got the crunch of the shortbread cookie the white cookie we know well here on the Oreo Oration then the
